page.title: 03HOUSING LEADENHAM
page.content: The original part of the village mainly consists of stone built houses which front directly on to the pavement.Until recently these were owned by the Leadenham Estate,but a number of these have now been sold off.Many of the old cottages have been modernised but have retained their character and thick stone walls.As the village lies in a conservation area there are restrictions on the alterations which can be made to the buildings and to the walls.Recently, development has taken place towards the north end of the village with, around 1963, the building of the bungalows in Queensway and the houses in North Road.During the last few years,the development called Waterloo Paddock has been completed.These are modern houses,brick built,set back from the road,each having a garage.
